span.p: Please refer to the district's Coronavirus Updates and Information page for the most current information on how the Coronavirus outbreak is impacting the Manasquan School District and other information about our health-related school closure.

Free or reduced-lunch benefits are accepted throughout the year, and lunch services for those students eligible for these benefits are continuing during the school closure. If you would like to apply for these benefits, please reach out to Sandi Freeman at sfreeman@manasquan.k12.nj.us for an application. Please include whether you would like the application e-mailed or mailed to your home.

a.title: Go to comments for Coronavirus Information

span.span: School Buildings Closed to Staff & Public

span.p: In following with the most recent state guidelines during our health-related school closing, District buildings are CLOSED to most staff and the public with the following limited exceptions:

ul.li: Security staff will be available at the Manasquan High School gymnasium entrance from 10 am to 1pm weekdays for technology support.
Free/reduced lunch pickup will also be at the high school gym entrance from 11-1.

span.p: During this closing, most of our staff, including administrators, teachers, counselors, child study team, etc. are working remotely from home and are still available via email should you need to contact them.

We have also established a voicemail number for each school that will be monitored daily by the on-duty administrator to address any questions that you wish to leave by phone. The Manasquan HS voicemail can be reached at 732-528-8820 Ext. 1990. The Manasquan ES voicemail can be reached at 732-528-8810 Ext. 2990. Of course, you can continue to leave voicemail messages for specific staff members at their extension as they also receive these via email.
